sect2.title: Installing the Windows Azure SDK
sect2.para:
There are two development scenario's when working with Windows Azure.
You can develop your application using Microsoft_Azure and the Windows Azure SDK, which provides a local developent environment of the services provided by Windows Azure's cloud infrastructure.
You can develop your application using Microsoft_Azure, working directly with the Windows Azure cloud infrastructure.

The first case requires you to install the Windows Azure SDK on your development machine. It is currently only available for Windows environments, progress is being made on a Java-based version of the SDK which can run on any platform.
The latter case requires you to have an account at Azure.com.

sect2.title: API Documentation
sect2.para: The Microsoft_Azure class provides the PHP wrapper to the Windows Azure REST interface. Please consult the REST documentation for detailed description of the service. You will need to be familiar with basic concepts in order to use this service.

sect2.title: Features
sect2.para:
Microsoft_Azure provides the following functionality:
PHP classes for Windows Azure Blobs, Tables and Queues (for CRUD operations)
Helper Classes for HTTP transport, AuthN/AuthZ, REST and Error Management
Manageability, Instrumentation and Logging support

sect2.title: Architecture
sect2.para: Microsoft_Azure provides access to Windows Azure's storage, computation and management interfaces by abstracting the REST/XML interface Windows Azure provides into a simple PHP API.
An application built using Microsoft_Azure can access Windows Azure's features, no matter if it is hosted on the Windows Azure platform or on an in-premise web server.
